Premetto che veniamo da una macchinetta a capsule dolce gusto (preferita con capsule bar) e devo dire che dopo alcune prove con vari caffé, la De'Longhi risulta di gran lunga migliore quando utilizzata con Kimbo Espresso Napoletano. il Caffé se fatto con questa miscela, ristretto e abbondando col macinato, viene più denso che al bar. Se fatto non ristretto viene buono e corposo. Va detto che almeno nel nostro caso viene meglio se si utilizza il filtro per due tazze rispetto al filtro per una. Anche la mia compagna che è molto esigente ha apprezzato la nuova arrivata. La macchina è sicuramente meno pratica di una con capsule, ma dà molta più soddisfazione. La consigliamo a chi ha voglia di confrontarsi con un minimo di sbattimenti (dosa il caffé, pigia, pulisci la macchina) per ottenere un risultato notevole.Spero di provarla presto con altre marche tipo Passalacqua e Pellini.Aggiornamento dopo anni di utilizzo. È ancora perfetta e abbiamo addirittura trovato un caffè migliore: il Passalacqua Alambra. Fantastico.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Comincio con il dire che sono specializzato nel mondo del caffè.Come si fa a costruire una macchina da caffè espresso con un portafiltro che contiene un filtro di capienza massima di caffè macinato di 13 grammi. Quando che anche sull'etichetta del caffè di qualità più bassa leggiamo scritto: dosi per caffè espresso doppio 14g. Per non parlare del sistema di pressurizzazione del filtro al quanto inutile. State rovinando la cultura del caffè in Italia. Parlo al plurale perché la colpa per primi ai torreffattori che tostano caffè bruciati, solo per non mettere in risalto le 24859385 qualità differenti sempre se la parola qualità la si può utilizzare. Crearne la loro miscela "gold", macinandola il più grossolanamente possibile per averne la certezza che poi a casa il cliente x riesca comunque estrarne l'espresso. Poi tanto abbiamo la nostra macchina per caffè espresso de longhi che con il filtro pressurizzato risolve tutti i problemi di macinatura e pressatura creando la favolosa "crema" e siamo contenti e soddisfatti del nostro espresso italiano.Credo che con veramente piccoli accorgimenti potreste realizzare macchine per caffè espresso decisamente migliori. Soprattutto voi aziende Italiane luogo in cui ha avuto inizio la cultura del caffè espresso.Al quanto insoddisfatto dell'articolo acquistato.In allegato le modifiche che ho dovuto apportare per migliorare la qualità dell'estrazione. (Sostituito il filtro con uno non pressurizzato e più capiente, estratto la plastica che direziona la fuoriuscita dell'espresso, tagliondola per altezza facendo modo da poter inserire il filtro più alto.Per migliorare la montatura del latte ho sostituito il pennarello del vapore con una lancia vapore interamente in acciaio con 3 microfori che migliorano la montatura del latte.Per chi cerca un buon caffè espresso sconsiglio questa macchina.Consiglio invece a chi ha poca esperienza, a chi non interessa la qualità dell'estrazione.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Bought this to replace more basic model of Delonghi coffee maker. I found this model (Dedica style) not very user friendly.1. Coffee holder difficult to twist on and engage.2.After using frother for milk, the boiler is too hot to dispense coffee for a while.3.Used coffee grounds will not eject easily from pod leading to a very messy and time consuming broddle with a teaspoon.This is the most irritating feature of this machine - previous model had a much easier ejection procedure.On the plus side it does make a fair cup of java.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: I am writing this review after spending 25,000 on a coffee machine which has been lying idle for over 3 months now for the want of spare part.I have used a Delonghi Nespresso for over 7 years now,.So when time came to change my coffee machine, i wanted to replace it with another Delonghi (given my previous good experience with Delonghi) and bought it in January 2021.This machine works like a charm, once u get ur hands on it.The machine has an attachments, which can be used to either draw one or 2 shots of coffee.Plus the frother that comes gives u an option to either warm the milk or froth the milk.So all in all its an amazing piece of machine and it does what its been designed to do perfectly.However, my experience has not been good.The machine has 4 star reviews, but these are most from international buyers.I ignored the previous poor reviews which had been given by Indian Buyers.After one month of using the machine, the hose of the frother which delivers the steam, cracked while frothing the milk.Their service partner Orient has not been able to send the replacement part putting the blame on Delonghi not supporting them for the spare parts.A lot of previous review by Indian buyers had pointed towards their bad experience of the after sales services Orient and my bad luck that i had to face the same.To summarise, the machine is good. But avoid buying in India. These kind of machines tend to need service support which is missing.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: I am disgusted with this. The smell from the coffee machine I received in the post today is vile. Somehow it smells like rotten milk. Obviously there is damage and scratches etc, as this is from Amazon Warehouse Deals, so I expected a damaged box (not machine)  But I did not know the products were also used. You can see dried up coffee in the filter. Not loads, but enough to make my stomach turn. How long has this been sitting there. With coffee stained packaging too! Health and safely regulations were clearly missed here. My treat to myself, clearly was a disaster and I got screwed over.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Leckerer Kaffee, leicht zu bedienen, sieht wirklich toll aus: ich liebe meine neue Espressomaschine.Dennoch hatte ich prompt nach zwei Wochen auch das Problem, daß auf einmal kein Druck mehr aufgebaut wurde, um Espresso aufzubrühen (da gibt es ja einige negative Rezensionen deswegen). Nach tausend Versuchen ging sie wieder. Nach zwei Wochen wieder nicht. Nirgendwo eine Antwort, die "technische Beratung" bei Amazon hatte auch keine Ahnung. Ich wollte schon zurückschicken.Aber dann fand ich die völlig einfachen Lösungen:1. Möglichkeit: WassertankSteht schon in der Bedienungsanleitung (liest halt niemand): bei längerem Betrieb kann sich der Wassertank durch Vibrationen irgendwann aus den Ventilen heben, es kommt nicht mehr genug Wasser nach, um Druck aufzubauen.Warum haben aber nur wenige Nutzer dieses Problem?Weil es nicht auftaucht, wenn man den Wassertank zum Befüllen ABNIMMT. Danach klickt man ihn ja jedesmal ein. So wird er normalerweise alle zwei bis drei Tage also neu eingerastet.Ich aber befülle mit einer Kanne und nehme den Tank deshalb nie ab... Wenn dann die Maschine einige Wochen gebrummt hat, hebt sich durch die Vibrationen so langsam der Tank um einen Milimeter aus der Rastung heraus und irgendwann schließen die Ventile und es kommt kein Druck mehr.Also alle paar Tage mal ein wenig den Tank herunterdrücken: Problem gelöst!2. Möglichkeit: SiebträgerGelegentlich fällt beim Abklopfen das Zwischensieb in die Knockbox (siehe Bild).Wer es dann (wie ich) einfach herausfischt und sofort wieder befestigt, der macht einen Fehler.Normalerweise befindet sich auf der Unterseite des Siebes nämlich nie Kaffeepulver, dies bleibt ja im Sieb zurück. Nun bringt man aber durch Faulheit Pulver unter das Sieb. Beim nächsten Brühen werden diese Reste (mit viel Druck) in das winzige Loch vom Siebträger gedrückt. Beim nächsten Mal noch mehr...Irgendwann hat man dieses Loch dann mit viel Druck so richtig verstopft, man backt sich ja regelrecht einen Verschluß. Und prompt kommt kein Espresso mehr heraus.Fällt also das Zwischensieb mal in Kaffeesatz, immer den Siebträger ausspülen und das Zwischensieb dann abgespült einsetzen. Es darf kein Pulver unter dem Zwischensieb sein.Ist der Siebträger schon verstopft: mit Spülmittel säubern.Seit ich diese beiden Dinge beherzige, hatte ich nicht einmal mehr Druckabfall - aber jeden Tag leckeren Espresso.PS: Empfehlenswert ist es, ein Mikrofasertuch fürs Abwischen der Maschine zu kaufen. De'Longhi hat leider an einer Fingerabdruckversiegelung gespart, die Edelstahlvariante sieht nur so immer schön aus. Aber dann sieht sie dafür wirklich schön aus.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Pros1. Price to value ratio for this product is very high. I purchased this for ~ £120.2. Quick start up time. Great quality coffee in less than 2min.3. In my experience, it works best for single espresso shots or with ese pods.4. I only make espresso or americano and I am very happy with the results from this little machine.5. Can accommodate various size cups.6. Very small footprint. This is totally what sold it for me.7. I have successfully used several different types of beans with the unit - very happy with the results.Cons1. Tricky to use for double espresso shots. It might be just me, but if you don't get the right amount (you need less than 2 full scoops using the provided scoop), all sorts of issues follow - no flow etc. Single espresso or ese pods work perfectly everytime.Areas to improve1. A low water indicator would be nice2. A dedicated double espresso scoopThe above features can be added without a significant impact on the price and no impact to other delonghi products.One could list a whole range of improvement areas that if addressed would result in a completely different and much more expensive product (which probably already exists). So there's no point in going there.I can't say anything about the milk frother, making cappuccinos etc. as I haven't used that functionality as of yet. Nevertheless, I would recommend this unit without hesitation. I am going to pick up the companion grinder next - should be a match made in coffee heaven!!!

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Zunächst war ich sehr zufrieden mit der Espresso Siebträgermaschine. Alles funktionierte wie beschrieben und die Qualität von Espresso und Cappuccino war sehr gut. Aber bereits am dritten Tag, nach wenigen "Einsätzen", funktionierte die Ein/Aus-Taste plötzlich nicht mehr. Nun muss ich das Gerät zurückschicken.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Pour l'instant très content, discrète et peu bruyante... À voir dans le temps...Café goutu et bien chaud !!!Au revoir les capsules hors de prix de Georges 😂

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: It broke down this month at 7 months old. ! It no longer pumps the water through the coffee chamber.!!Then when one releases the coffee chamber A sudden release off pressure can lead to hot water spitting out and all over the hand

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Sans déconner, arrêtez avec vos Nespresso. Vous avez ici l'opportunité d'acheter une authentique marque italienne et pas chez l'énorme conglomérat maléfique qui est Nestlé. De plus, vous pourrez prendre le café que vous voudrez et le prix du café en grain est quasi 10 fois moins cher que des capsules. Si vous êtes un gros consommateur comme moi (3 par jour en moyenne), votre conso de café à l'année devrait rembourser l'achat de la machine comparé à des capsules (j'ai eu près 200€ de différence en passant des capsules au grain)En plus, niveau qualité, pour peu que vous preniez du café de ouf, ça n'a RIEN à voir. Prenez vous un ptit moulin à 10 balles pour moudre le café et vous verrez que ça aura été la meilleure décision de votre vie, vraiment.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Mine arrived today, and I've just spent about an hour making my first cup. This is my first experience with anything other than a fully-automated machine (I'm replacing my Nespresso due to environmental concerns over the pods). The instruction manual is brief and seems correct, but every word in it counts, so extremely close attention to every detail is required. I got better instructions from YouTube. You'll need several vessels to catch variously hot water, splatters and squirts, and a damp cloth to mop up everything that goes over the side.Here are a few tips for other complete newbies:1. First problem: the 3-pin plug doesn't go fully into my 2-plug wall outlet, which none of the other things I've plugged in have done. This means that the lights would only come on if I pressed hard on the plug to fully engage it. It works fine in the other side, so problem solved.2. Be sure to take all the bits out of the box. I've just located my 1-cup filter (tucked into the styrofoam insert) after mistakenly using the coffee pod filter for my first cup. The machine came with the 2-cup filter inserted. The attached photo shows all 3, with 2 removable rubber-ringed inserts. The filters fit tightly into the base (filter holder), held in by 3 side springs, so use some force to pull them out and push them in until they click. There is a little notch in the filter base that you can use with your fingertip to pull out the filter.3. I'm still mystified about why the 1-cup and 2-cup buttons sometimes flash 3 times rapidly, pause, and repeat. The manual shows this could be caused by 4 different things. Eventually they go on solidly.4. I'll wait until later to fiddle with the programmable settings, as I got myself into blinking-light-purgatory and had to turn the whole thing off for awhile. There are settings for coffee temperature (low-medium-high); water hardness (soft-medium-hard), which presumably affects how often the descaling reminder light comes on; and the time until the machine turns itself off (9-30-180 min). You can also programme the volume of coffee delivered, which I'll try later.Once I had managed making the first cup, it took another hour to figure out how to heat the milk.1. The manual says to press the steam button, and 'the light flashes', but it doesn't seem to do so each time I tried it; sometimes it comes on solid straight away. It is supposed to flash until it is ready to dispense steam and then go solid, so I'll have to figure out how that all works; otherwise the rest of the exercise is futile because I got a bit of hot water and then nothing else.2. There is a mystifying icon on the 'cappucino maker selection ring' which points upwards for 'hot milk' and downwards for 'cappucino'. The whole metal stem/black plastic icon ring also rotates about an eighth-turn anti-clockwise to enable you to pull the whole thing downwards and remove it for cleaning. The black plastic ring with the icons on it is meant to be pushed towards the sky for hot milk, and towards the ground for frothing, sliding up and down around the metal cylinder. I know this seems stupid to have to describe, but if I didn't understand it maybe you don't either.3. Once you finally get all the stars in alignment, you turn the steam dial (A11 on the diagram) to the steam position, and let it purge water and air into an empty vessel for a few seconds. Steam dial up, get your milk container (I use a Pyrex 1-cup measure with 100ml milk), then down again, and-- at last-- you hear a rhythmic clunking from inside (the 'thermoblock') and you'll get all the steam you need to heat up the milk and/or make it froth.4. Then you wipe the milk off the metal stem, until it's time to disassemble the entire works for cleaning for the day.Final step is to go back on Amazon to buy that 500-gram 51-mm diameter coffee tamper you apparently just must have, and you might as well go for the kit and get the thermometer for the milk and the stainless steel jug. While drinking your new environmentally-friendly, thickly-frothed, 15p-per-cup cold espresso/cappucino/still wondering what a latté is, look up more videos on YouTube!25 July update: I'm getting along much better with it, although I still get two blinking lights in bursts of 3 after I finish steaming the milk. I can get my morning cups made in about 3-4 minutes. The coffee really is delicious, much better than the Nespresso-- and I'm not even a coffee snob. I'm using a bag of beans bought from M&S for £2.50, and it tastes like hot chocolate!

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: I bought this machine to replace a previous De'Longhi model that final died. It shares some of the design and functions of that previous model. There, all comparisons end. Over the years, I have got through many espresso machines: some great - some not so great, some small - some huge. A few have been absolute monsters. One even went out in a massive explosion. None have disappointed as much as this one though.The machine is small and light. Without the heavy filter attachment, it's not really much heavier than a large box of tea bags. Seriously. I have packets of coffee that weigh no more than the main body of this machine.To understand why this is a problem, we need to look at the location of the buttons on the top. They are on a sloped part of the main body, close to the top of the machine.So you fill the heavy filter attachment and go to slot it in. It's a tight fit and the machine is too lightweight to deal with it, so the machine begins to turn on your worktop. You have to grip the machine firmly to stop it moving, but that holder is still very tight. You get it part way, but it's certainly not firmly in place. You grip the top of the machine more firmly - fingers over the side trying to gain more purchase ... and ... you accidentally hit one of the buttons and water starts pouring out, hissing and bursting out of the top of the filter attachment, because it's not firmly locked in place. The pressure wants to turn the filter back, but you grip tightly, trying to hold it in place, but it's no good. The machine is so light that it turns under the pressure and the filter is thrown out, wet coffee grounds flying in all directions.After you have cleaned everything up, you try again, this time being careful where you put your fingers. You try to put a mug under the filter but ... there's not enough space. Not enough space for a small mug or a large cup. You're going to have to use a small cup or measuring jug.But, hey ... coffee's on it's way.Hit the one cup option. You get a tiny little bit of coffee - not enough to get all that coffee goodness you have in the filter. Never mind for now ... let's use the hot milk function and drink the coffee.The hot milk function just dumps hot water into your milk. There's three times as much liquid as you started with and the 1 part milk/2 parts water mix is barely warm.You pour it into the minuscule drip of coffee and are rewarded with a cup of luke warm water, faintly flavoured with milk and coffee.Pour it away and try again.Now we wait for the machine to reset itself after using the water/steam attachment.Time passes. Lots of time passes. Several minutes pass. Finally it says it's ready for your next drink.Fill the filter. Carefully insert it. Straighten up the machine, which has revolved around 100 degrees counter clockwise.Let's try two servings.That's going better. Getting all the coffee now. OK, stop. Stop! STOOOP! It's just  adding hot water now!OK, finally stopped. Let's try Cappuccino mode on the steam attachment.Hmmm ... It's just adding loads of water to the milk again.This time, you  have slightly stronger, but more watery, barely warm coffee.As you pour it down the sink and go to leave the kitchen in disgust, your kettle looks at you and seems to whisper, "I think you could do with a nice hot cup of tea after all that!".You look back at the useless coffee machine you just bought and conclude that Mr Russel Hobbs may be right. about that.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: This coffee machine is so easy to use when it is working and makes great coffee. However... first purchased in October 2018, it worked perfectly for us for 6 months before the pump died and it lost all power to push coffee through. We ended up with just a few cold drops. After troubleshooting, we gave up and got a replacement machine. This second machine only lasted about 6 weeks before it did EXACTLY the same thing. We also have a friend who bought the same machine and it only lasted a few months for them too. It is such a shame because until it breaks - we were really happy with it. This time, rather than opting for a third machine, we decided to buy a more expensive and more durable machine!

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: I've had this machine for more than 3 months so this is review after using it every day since.Overall I would not recommend this machine because it's made of poor quality materials that RUST and it's not easy to use if you plan to use the foamning feature.Overall:Pros: yields good coffeeCons: the machine is a nightmare to use. First of all it leaks water from the water tank like crazy. I've checked and checked but there doesn't seem to be anything wrong with how it's placed, but it leaks water!!! You can see in the first pic.Then after you foam the milk you need to MANUALLY cool the machine and do a whole other process that is very messy for which you need at least 2 extra utensils (a cup on top of which you need to put a towel or something if you dont want  boiling water to be splashed on you!).And then the machine already has RUST! as you can see in 2 of pics, i think this is not acceptable, not even for this price band which isn't super expensive but it's not cheap either.Espresso quality:Pros: makes good coffee if you have the right coffeeCons: if the coffee is even slightly more finely grinded, it wont workFoam quality:Pros: if you manage to make it right, it produces nice foam and the overall coffee + foam is better than i've had in many place in london. Pret, Costa, Nero coffee are disgusting compared to this.Cons: if you want to make cappuccino (so bigger bubbles) then you're fine with the nozzle as it is. But if you want to make a microfoam then it wont work. I had to remove the nozzle and leave just the rubber wand that it covers because this way you have control over how deep the wand goes in the milk.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: La macchina si presenta con una struttura solida. Scocca in metallo e ottime rifiniture. La qualità è alta. È una classica macchina con pompa a 15 bar di pressione quindi non aspettatevi il caffè da Bar (dovete spendere oltre 1500€ per una con pompa a pressione costante).Istruzioni chiare. Per effettuare le varie procedure.Consiglio la giusta macinatura e per questo un buon macinatore. Ho provato il caffè macinato da moka i risultati sono accettabili ma essendo amante del caffè, preferisco macinarlo sul momento dopo aver tirato fuori il barattolo dal frigo.Uso un macinatore elettronico Gaggia di 15 anni fa.I cappuccini vengono montati egregiamente, la schiuma è persistente e cremosa. Usate latte intero e fresco. Rimane scomodo da usare, troppo attaccato al corpo macchina e poco mobile comunque ci si abitua...Cosa dovrebbe migliorare?Il dosatore/pressa per il caffè.Il cappuccinatore.Consigliata.Anche sotto sforzo non perde un colpo. Resistente.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   Had this for around 4 months & I'm wishing I'd bought something else! The product is dangerous to use as with use the filter arm rotates & comes off explosively. Scalding water & ground coffee fly every where. The only way to stop this is to hold the arm of the filter when in operation. I've already had to send the product off for repair after only 4 months of light use, which doesn't bode well for the future!Save yourself the hassle & waste of money!UpdateSo after not hearing anything from the repair service for nearly 2 months I chased them up to find that my nearly new espresso machine had been written off! DeLonghi apparently should've already sent me a new one! So another call this time to De Longhi..... And after 40 minutes of queuing and being cut off, to phoning again, queuing & being cut off I decided to email them. No response. A week later a new espresso machine got delivered by dpd without warning.Seriously.... Extremely poor customer service rubbing salt into the wound of a broken down machine. Lesson learned I guess....

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: I had this machine for a little over a month and the steamer never seemed to work properly, at first I thought it might be the way I was using it but in the end after speaking to Delonghi customer services they decided it needed to be repaired - a bit disappointing after just five weeks of use but at least they were doing something about it.It would apparently take two weeks to repair - not so bad right? Two weeks isn't that long in the whole scheme of things and that sort of time flies by when I'm on holiday.SEVEN. WEEKS. LATER.My coffee machine is back! Yay I'm so excited. No more trips to Cafe Nero.WRONG! The little note from the repairers says "No issues found" so I plug in back in again thinking maybe they have a magic touch, some special reset button was pressed that only they know about...Nope, it's still broken, in fact it appears to be worse! I can't get any steam out of the thing now.So I call up Delonghi Customer Service again, they are nice friendly people and surely they will be mortified that it's still broken especially as it's been so long at the repairs. It only takes about 45 minutes to get though and the hold music is largely just static so I was kept entertained until I finally spoke to Tom.Tom was very sad for me and he agreed that my problem wasn't good news at all so he suggested sending it back to the repairers for them to look at it again. I suggested a different solutionWhy don't you send me a new machine and I'll send the broken one back?No, says Tom, That's impossible.Why? I askBecause it might be repairable, says TomBut it never worked properly from the beginning, I sayThat's company policy, says TomAs we all know company policy is something that never be changed, can it? I mean, it feels like it could if they really wanted to but I guess Delonghi Customer Services don't want to so what can I do.After sitting in the kitchen for all of a couple of hours back it goes to the repairers to be looked at again but at least it's going to the front of the repair queue so it's not all bad.  Oh but it looks like even at the front of the queue it can take 15 days to do what I did in 15 minutes, bad times.Hopefully one day I'll be able to use this machine again or maybe it'll be one if it's little brothers or sisters as this one is clearly BROKEN. Thanks Delonghi, thanks a bunch.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: I chose this for its SLIM 'FOOTPRINT'; in my kitchen it has to be tucked into a corner of the worktop then brung forward each time because you need arm room to fill the tank at the back, and to swivel the coffee container and the frother steam nozzle. It’s HEAVY so not easy to drag on a worktop so - TOP TIP - I made a glider by drawing round the oval base shape (used double thickness of card from the box) included a little tugging lip at the front, and it now glides easily to/fro/left/right. Or buy a small tray. Frothing took me a week to master. I use a steel jug 5ins deep and add 1-2ins milk, the nozzle reaches the bottom, the milk expands, then you can start lowering the jug so the nozzle tip (where the steam comes out) is just below the surface creating more air bubbles. It heats up the milk which is good as these machines don’t provide a boiling hot drink. Be prepared to ALWAYS WIPE DOWN the machine and surrounding surfaces because THE MILK SPLATTERS EVERYWHERE. It comes with 3 measures (ID is underneath) I think the 2scoop measure is ideal for one coffee. The 1scoop is best for a small shot espresso-size. Mug height, it will take up to approx 5ins. So, I’m using no more coffee than the cafetière but I’m getting a far superior coffee taste AS GOOD AS ANY COFFEE SHOP 👍

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Ditched my Nespresso capsule machine  in favour of the De'longhi which has substantially reduce the cost per cup and even more substantially increased the flavour. This also allows freedom to experiment with all ground coffee brands ; my personal favourite  being LavAzza which can often be picked up " on special" in supermarkets.It can be set for a double or single cup and after brief experimentation you can get the exact taste and consistency that suits you for Espresso, Americano etc etc. The milk frother/heater is simple to use and clean and does give that special  touchIt needs a little more cleaning time compared to the capsule type machines, but it's worth that extra minute for real top quality, coffee that transports you to a pavement cafe in Bella Italia..........well almost.It's an economical, low maintenance, excellent coffee maker at a reasonable initial cost. An absolute winner for me.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: J’ai acheté également le moulin à café Delonghi KG521m et je suis satisfaite.J’ai reçu ce matin la machine à café et pendant les premiers manipulations de réglages, j’ai eu la surprise: dès le premier jour, le plateau d’égouttage a été rayé... Cela veut dire que il n’est pas fait pour supporter les tasses...😳 Dommage.Pour le café, c’est très, très bon !Oui, je recommande ce produit

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Nothing wrong with this machine makes a decent cup of coffee! However, I had a de Longhi Scultura before this and so have to make the comparison with that one and then it falls a little short.I bought the Dedica because it was rated higher than the Scultura but I don't agree with those ratings. When using a pod the crema on the espresso is good but not as good as the Scultura. It is virtually non existent on an americano whereas the Scultura was always more acceptable. It improves when using loose coffee like Lavazza.The cappuccino's are pretty good but took a while to get the technique right.Why didn't I return the machine? Because I kept looking at the ratings and comments and assumed it was me still adjusting to it so held on to it too long to return. But as I said, it does make decent coffee just doesn't match up to my previous machine and it does take up less room!

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: A superb coffee maker. So pleased with it. Sturdy but slimline and easy to use. Takes the ESSA coffee pods which are convenient and mess free. It also takes ground coffee. The latte/cappuccino milk frothed option is excellent as I can quickly warm milk for making hot chocolate as well. The best feature of this coffee maker is how hot the coffee is. I've bought other coffee makers and at best it made lukewarm coffee. This DeLonghi makes really hot coffee and the machine heats up within 30 second from switching on. Easy to clean. Highly recommend this coffee machine.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Depuis une quinzaine d'années environ, j'utilise des machines à café et je dois reconnaître que celle-ci est vraiment excellente. Elle est comme grand mère, elle sait faire un bon café.J'utilise deux cafés différents. Celui du matin, assez corsé est fait pour réveiller et un autre plus "raffiné" pour la journée. Si je dis ça c'est pour souligner un point vraiment positif. Il est possible de régler la quantité d'eau pour une tasse et pour deux tasses. Perso j'ai réglé pour chacun des deux cafés. Comme j'ai pris l'habitude de faire les cafés à l'unité, ça tombe très bien.Autre bon point, le mode d'emploi, en français et très bien détaillé. Vous verrez comment régler également la température de l'eau, sa dureté, le temps de veille.Après avoir rincé la machine comme indiqué, vous allez pouvoir vous faire un bon café. Le fonctionnement est super simple, il n'y a qu'à appuyer sur un bouton. Si ça ne fonctionne pas, c'est que la machine n'est pas sous tension. L'interrupteur est en bas sur le côté droit. L'endroit n'est pas forcément le mieux choisi mais une fois qu'on le sait...Avant de faire cet achat, j'ai lu les commentaires et en particulier les négatifs . A l'usage, je les trouve un peu excessifs. Certains trouvent la machine trop bruyante. Manifestement ils en sont à leur première machine de ce type car elle est vraiment silencieuse si on la compare à d'autres dans la même gamme de prix.J'ai lu qu'un monsieur se plaignait qu'elle ne fasse que 15 bars. Là aussi, il y a un manque de connaissance. Dix à douze bars sont largement suffisants pour faire un expresso. Ma dernière machine affichait 20 bars mais ce n'est qu'un argument commercial, le café n'était pas meilleur pour autant.Une critique qu'on trouve ici et qu'on trouve à propos de la plupart des machines, le café ne coule pas et n'est pas bon. Normal! La rondelle qu'il y a à l'extrémité de la cuillère n'est pas faite pour tasser la mouture. Si vous voulez que votre café dégage tous ses arômes, il faut qu'il soit aéré, que l'eau puisse circuler librement et atteindre chaque grain de votre mouture. Utilisez cette "rondelle" juste pour égaliser votre mouture sans forcer.Le café n'a pas le goût de celui du bistrot d'en bas. Normal également, il est fort peu probable que vous utilisiez le même café. Essayez un mélange Arabica/Robusta. Plus vous mettrez de Robusta et plus votre café sera corsé. Pour savoir quel café choisir le mieux est d'en tester plusieurs et de faire votre choix ensuite. Je me permets de la dire, dans le commerce équitable vous allez trouver d'excellents crus qui ne sont pas forcément plus cher que ceux on on voit les pubs. Attention tout de même, sur certaines plateformes de vente, certains vendeur vous vendent des paquets de café jusqu'à dix fois plus cher que ce qu'ils ne sont vendus en grande surface.En tout état de cause, cette machine est vraiment bien pour un prix raisonnable.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Great machine. It has roughly the same footprint as my Dulce Gusto Melody 3.Taken me a day to get the hang of it, and work out  the perfect (for me) latte and mocha.The only gripe I have is that it is incredibly hard to push the filter holder around into the lock position. I have found it helpful to have the machine switched off when doing this to avoid pushing the buttons inadvertently.That being said….it more than makes up for this by being PODLESS!Useful to buy a couple of espresso shot glasses and a metal milk jug…. And if, like me, you like really hot coffee, steam the milk twice. :-)Cost: Dolce Gusto at £3.50 for 8 drinks equates to 43.75p per drink. A 250gm of Illy ground coffee is £6.50, and using 5 gms per drink, equates to 50 drinks at 13p per coffee. Adding  300 ml of semi skimmed milk (I like a latte)  at 80p a litre takes the overall cost of a latte to 37p.  Saves 6.75p per latte. AND NO POD!Plus the grounds are good for the garden.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Design tra i migliori sul mercato e facilità d’uso/pulizia, caffè otttimo e con una bella crema ma l’unico problema è la temperatura!La modalità di gestione della temperatura è davvero ridicola e anche riuscendo a impostarla sul max il caffè è poco più che tiepido! Davvero un peccato perché a questo prezzo sarebbe stato davvero un gioiellino!

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Mittlerweile ist es die dritte EC 685. Die beiden ersten Modelle wurden innerhalb einer Woche bei Amazon reklamiert und getauscht. Einmal konnte die Maschine keinen Druck aufbauen, die andere fing sehr schnell an zu "Lecken".Ende November war der letzte Austausch, bis jetzt hat das letzte Modell gehalten. Nun geht die Tropferei auch hier wieder los. Beim Espressobezug läuft es aus der Dampfdüse und anders herum. Am Ende steht die Maschine halb ine iner kleinen Pfütze.Diese starke Abnutzung bei nicht einmal täglicher Benutzung (höchstens alle zwei Tage) ist auch bei diesem günstigen Preis nicht vertretbar.Hier kann ich mich den Vorrednern nur anschließen: Lieber etwas sparen und mehr investieren und dann etwas vernünftiges für längere Zeit haben.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: This makes good espresso and cappuccino, we've been using it more than we thought! Really good value for money, although it's important to read the manual and watch a couple of YouTube videos to make sure it's being used correctly.Really glad we didn't get one of those that works with capsules. This one takes a big longer but the result pays for it and it's very easy to clean

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: I've really persisted with this machine. I bought my own coffee grinder to get exactly the right consistency of grounds, a tamper and tried all ways to get a decent, medium strength cup of coffee. I have failed. The steam wand produces a warmish cup of milk with a glob of foam on top. The resulting drink is lukewarm at best so needs a final microwave. I know they've had to make compromises to get it at this price point, but it just doesn't do the job.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Mine arrived yesterday after 2 days of having to drink instant coffee, not a pleasant experience.My previous Swan espresso machine stopped working after 2 yrs, pump just stopped pumping. Before that I had a Nespresso machine that used pods which also packed up after a couple of years due to pump failure.Let's hope this one lasts a little longer.This machine is solidly built, has a good quality feel to it. Everything fits well together.  The two features that I like about this machine is the automatic stop and the fast turnaround time. The reheat is instantaneous thanks to the use of thermoblock heating system, and it's ready for the next one before you even have time to empty and refill the coffee ground.The water capacity is only 1L but it's really not a problem because filling it is so easy.The noise is no worse than any other machines and there's hardly any vibration thanks to the solid and weighty construction.The programmable setting menu is not the most obvious and intuitive to use but you only have to do it once. You can set the water temperature, water hardness, water amount for each of the cup settings, and there's a descaling programme you need to use from time to time. There"re only 3 buttons and lights, so you adjust the settings by pressing and/or holding the buttons in different sequences. You won't remember which is which after 3 months, so keep the instruction booklet safe!!The result is a lovely rich, smooth aromatic coffee with good crema lasting well into the minutes, and that's with normal off the shelve supermarket pre-ground Lavazza espresso coffee ground.It taste much better than the Swan machine that I had, with much smoother coffee, less bitterness and much better and longer lasting crema, all with the same coffee ground.I'm sure if you spent a 4 figure sum on a machine you'll get a better result comparable to the professionals, but for a mere mortal I doubt I'll be able to easily tell the difference. It's simple to use for a daily morning coffee, it's easy to use, no fuss, easy to clean. For a machine south of the couple of hundred pounds it's definitely a good buy.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Es de las mejores cafeteras que se pueden comprar en Amazon. Compré una Solac en el prime day y la tuve que devolver (no recomiendo ninguna de esa marca). La máquina es totalmente programable (temperatura del agua, cantidad de café...).En cuanto le pillas el truco a la cantidad de café que debes depositar según vayas a hacer una o dos tazas, es muy fácil. Cuidado al colocar el portafiltros en la máquina, ya que puedes presionar sin querer el "botón de café de una taza". Es estrechas, bonita y ligera. El café es delicioso (nosotros tomamos un café torrefacto intenso). Y la espuma que crea con la leche es como la de un bar. Muy profesional.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Why oh why do manufacturers think no one wants to drink coffee from a MUG?? Well, hats off to De'Longhi for this cracking wee machine. It does have an add-on platform for the wee espresso cups, but that's relegated to the back of a cupboard for me.It also comes with 3 filters - for a 2 cup, a 1 cup, and one to take coffee pods - personally I detest the environmental profligacy associated with pods, but each to their own - but it's an option with this machine!This a smart wee machine -  you can choose between 3 heat setting for the coffee (Low/Med/High) - default id medium and I've left it at that - you can also set the water hardness through a menu, and a wee bonus, the machine is supplied with a descaler pack.Coffee making - there is some useful info in the instructions that will help you to make coffee to your particular taste. For me, I use Lavazza coffee after trialing many others, and I like my coffee strong - this machine delivers!It gives a measured amount of water for the filter size you are using - Tip - if you want to extract more, just run it again, but I recommend you don't - the machine does a great job of stopping at just the sweet spot for the extraction of the best part of the coffee, leaving the bitter 'tails' behind.Space wise, the machine is nice and slim, so takes up minimal space, and the water reservoir is a really good, big size, and easy to see the fill level as it's external.Now, the milk steamer - personally I don't use it - but if you do, it creates plenty, plenty of steam! I know this because the set up instructions ask you to run 5 measures through the filter, then switch to steam and run until the reservoir is empty - well frankly my kitchen was resembling a sauna before the reservoir was even half empty! So I did choose ignore the request to continue until empty...Cleaning - my last coffee machine lasted me many, many years, but had 1 weakness and 1 avoidable weakness..The coffee filter had a plate with many very fine holes, with a void behind that, and then the filter base base had one small hole leading to the spouts that deliver the coffee. Over time, the coffee solids built up behind the fine plate and blocked it - this machine has a removable filter plate - easy to maintain - brilliant!The 2nd issue with my old machine was the water distribution plate in the machine that the coffee presses up against once the filter holder is inserted into the machine - that plate should be periodically removed and clean behind it - on my old machine that needed a socket set and I left it too long resulting in pressure build up which burst a hose fitting on the high pressure side of the pump - this one just needs a Phillips screwdriver - easy - but don't ignore this for occasional cleaning, especially if you live in a hard water area.Overall then, a very smart machine, takes up minimal worktop space, is very functional, takes pretty much all mugs up to 12-13cm high (the taller ones you can probably manipulate in) and easy to clean. Love it!

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Great and compact machine when in use. Looks nice and makes decent drinkable coffee. The pump however is prone to breaking and a known issue. I purchased in April 2020 and the machine is now broken in Nov 2020. Pump has failed. My friend who bought the previous model now has the same issue and is looking to replace.Amazon have advised me against re-purchasing this machine as the pump failing is a known issue.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Its  OK, not great.The coffee is niceI love the slim factorBut the machine has some issues :The steam pump doesn't  work consistently and runs out of steamIf I use the steam I need to reset the machine before I can make the coffee (like for cappuccino)The coffe filter simply rests inside the extract bar. So when I take it off the filter stays attached to the machine, precariously. If it falls then there is coffee everywhere, if I need to make a second batch I burn my fingers to take it down

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: This little machine not only looks great but makes excellent coffee too. Small footprint so doesn't take up loads of counter space. The press basket fits snugly and the used coffee grounds are nearly dry immediately after the cycle so its easy to clean. Cleaning is best done soon after the press cycle is complete as the used grounds can set quite hard. The milk frother is very effective and doesn't take long(about 20 seconds for a standard cup latte) to bring the milk up to 64C (the more milk the longer it il take).There are only 3 multi function buttons one lever and an on/off switch so you need to read the instructions as its not very intuitive. However once I worked out what my regular setting is it was easy. I would still need to read the instructions to do anything else though so keep them safe.At this price the machine is excellent value and out performs many higher spec machines I have experience of.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Dopo aver passato un buon mesetto a leggermi recensioni di macchine per caffè sono arrivato alla conclusione che probabilmente questa De'Longhi Dedica era quella che faceva al caso mio. Si parla di buona qualità, prezzo accessibile, possibilità di utilizzare cialde o caffè macinato, cappuccinatore incluso. Dopo quasi un mese mi sento di dare la mia:- 📦 CONFEZIONE: Abbastanza soddisfatto di ciò che si trova in dotazione: oltre la macchina ci sono 3 filtri (1 per la cialda, 1 per caffè macinato tazza singola, 1 per caffè macinato per due tazze), un kit per la decalcificazione e il manuale.- ⚒ QUALITA': La macchina si presenta solida, robusta ed è anche bella da vedere. Noi l'abbiamo presa grigia che è un colore neutro che sta bene ovunque. Inizialmente questa stabilità è un po' minacciata dalla forza che serve per inserire e togliere il portafiltro, ma con il passare del tempo questo attrito si riduce e il movimento diventa più fluido.- 👅 SAPORE: Il sapore del caffè dipende molto dalla qualità che utilizzate, noi per ora stiamo usando cialde Kimbo e ci stiamo trovando bene, esce corposo e dal sapore deciso.Passiamo alle note negative...- 🌡 TEMPERATURA DEL CAFFE': Era il mio timore più grande perché avevo letto in più recensioni che non fosse adeguatamente elevata e devo dire che posso confermare. Purtroppo, nonostante abbia impostato la temperatura massima, il difetto più grande di questa macchinetta è proprio questo, per gustarsi un caffè decisamente caldo è necessario far uscire prima una tazzina di acqua (meglio due in realtà) a vuoto per scaldare la caldaia e poi preparare il caffè.Il problema è che se se ne devono fare più di due, il primo nel frattempo non avendo  comunque una temperatura elevata si raffredderà. Perciò andrebbe bevuto di corsa praticamente, appena fatto...Questa cosa per me non è ammissibile perché con una Nescafè a capsule da 50€ ottenevo caffè bollente senza farmi tante preoccupazioni!- 🧽 PULIZIA: Generalmente appena finisco di fare il caffè, tolgo il portafiltro, il filtro, li sciacquo per bene con acqua corrente e li asciugo. Inoltre passo un foglio di carta assorbente nel punto da cui fuoriesce l'acqua, essendo a contatto con la cialda/caffè macinato.Per fortuna, come detto già nel punto precedente, faccio sempre scorrere una tazzina di acqua a vuoto prima dell'utilizzo. Mi sono accorto infatti che, nel fare questa operazione, non esce acqua limpida ma leggermente macchiata di caffè, nonostante abbia fatto l'operazione di pulizia in precedenza! Perciò attenzione, fate scorrere sempre un po' di acqua prima di usarla, altrimenti berrete residui del precedente utilizzo!- 🎧 RUMORE: Tutto sommato non è molto rumorosa, ma se devo essere onesto a volte emette alcune vibrazioni che fanno un po' di casino. Niente di eccessivamente fastidioso comunque.- ☕️ CAPPUCCINATORE: Non è molto intuitivo in realtà. Comunque una volta capito il meccanismo, capisci che devi prima fare il caffè altrimenti, mentre monti il latte, la caldaia della macchinetta si surriscalda e va in blocco. Sul manuale c'è scritto di far uscire un po' di acqua a vuoto dall'ugello del vapore, ma nonostante abbia fatto diversi tentativi, non usciva più niente e ho dovuto che la macchinetta si raffreddasse autonomamente.___________________________________________________________________________________________- ❌CONCLUSIONI: La De'Longhi Dedica è una macchina di buona qualità, piacevole da utilizzare e che permette una buona esperienza con il caffè, ma non mi sento di promuoverla. Purtroppo la temperatura non è soddisfacente, a meno che non si utilizzino gli espedienti descritti in precedenza e per me questa è una grandissima pecca.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: J’ai pris cette machine pour gagner en praticité ;... ne plus utiliser de casserole pour chauffer mon lait, et ne plus avoir à perdre trop de temps à nettoyer ma cafetière à piston à chaque fois car  le café restait collé au fond.Mais avec cette nouvelle cafetière, les avantages pratique ne sont pas là ;-Le café une fois utiliser ne s’enlève pas en frappant le porte filtre sur un rebord... D'ailleurs c'est carrément le filtre qui saute. En faite il vous faudra prendre une cuillère pour retirer le plus gros, puis  rincer.  Mais c'est peut être le cas de toute les machines..- La buse à vapeur doit être démonté  à chaque usage dans le lait pour bien la nettoyer…- Il est conseiller d’utiliser la vapeur pas plus de 60secondes. Sauf que ça ne suffit pas pour que le lait soit bien chaud dans un gros Mug.- Impossible de refaire un café une fois la vapeur utiliser. Il faut d’abord éteindre la machine pour pouvoir refaire un café....C'est laborieux de passer de l'un à l'autre, si vous attendez plus de 15 secondes après avoir choisi la position vapeur, tout ce met à clignoter de nouveau.- A chaque fois que vous utiliser la vapeur, prévoir un verre à chaque première utilisation car la buse perd de l’eau sur le plan de travail.- Prévoir un support pour maintenir votre tasse le temps que ça chauffe.(Penser à fixer la cafetière sur un support solide car difficile de serrer le porte filtre sans appuyer sur les boutons .)Bref coté simplification d’utilisation, c’est pas vraiment ça.Avantage: -Je ne peux pas évaluer la saveur mais d'après un ami, c'est pas pour les palet délicat en café. - Pas trop bruyante.- Esthétique .Conclusion. Peut être moins laborieux d'utilisationsi vous ne vous en servez que pour le café, mais il reste moins fort que dans ma petite cafetière à piston avec la même quantité de café.bref c'est une moité de produit vendu au prix du tout inclut. éliminé.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Received as a birthday present, even tho I chose it myself, and really made up with it. Exceeded my expectations with regards to setting up, ease of use and quality of the coffee it makes. You can even set it for individual strength and temperature. It will make any coffee, including foaming milk, quicker than you can boil a kettle and make a mug of instant. Ideal for a small kitchen as the footprint on the worktop is no larger than a standard coffee perculator. Looks great and very easy to clean and keep shiny. There are numerous videos, both official and freelance, on every facet of this machine, so if apprehensive about any aspect, Google it and you'll find a video that covers it. Would recommend to both the novice and expert baristas out there. I would recommend buying a decent tamper and basket knock out bin, Delonghi ones are very good, to complement it.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Slightly disappointed with this machine. Took great care to follow the directions for use, even about warming the cups etc. But can I get a hot coffee out of it? No. Mildly warm. Perhaps the instructions for using the hot water setting not getting through to me. Thankfully the steamer works, so we have hot frothed milk. But not everyone takes milk. Will persevere. Like to look of it. Small footprint on my worktop. Seems sturdy. Firm on the worktop. Good delivery on time.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Really good home coffee machine for the price. We have the silver one and it is a nice quality/looking machine. Doesn't take up much space in our kitchen with limited work surface and was pleasantly surprised that you can change the heat the water gets to and amount of water that comes through your espresso. It also has a cup heater but that heats up after you've made a coffee so for our house where we only use it twice a day we don't get much use from this. It is a bit fiddly to change the settings but as long as you read the manual its alright and once you have it set how you want its straightforward. It's also really easy to get a good froth for your latte or cappuccino if that's something you're inexperienced with. Good for a household where you'll be making one or two cups at a time if you're using the milk frother as when it gets hot you have to vent it (to cool the water so it doesn't burn the next espresso) to go back and forth between that and making the next coffee, or let the coffee crema die on the earlier ones and do the milk in one go. But that's to be expected. It's just something to consider if you've not owned a machine before and want it for when you have a few guests. A pod machine might be more suitable for you. We're pretty happy with it for the price. The size works well for our current household. Good delonghi quality.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: First problem was the double shot filter. When after a very prolonged setting up operation  I tried to run the machine on the double filter shot  it would not pass any water through the filter into the cups. It built up tremendous pressure within the filter head. I removed the filter with difficulty because of the pressure that had built up, then cleaned it all out ,tried again numerous times with no success. I had just about decided to return it but gave it one last go without any coffee in it! Same thing, no flow, build up of pressure. I then examined the filter that I had cleaned so many times and found that the drip hole in the filter on manufacture had not been punched through properly so it would never work. I therefore punched a hole myself and a miraculous flow of water came through. Sadly this should not have happened and I am really disappointed with the Quality inspection of this company that allowed such a vital part of the equipment get by without proper scrutiny.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: I bought this machine as I have been searching for the perfect coffee at home. I am a bit of a crema addict and I can’t stand crema which is too loose or too small, I like lots of crema with my espresso. I had a Lidl espresso machine to start off with and it made wonderful shots with full bodied crema. But as with all Lidl products, the machine started to not perform as well and I then opted to go for a specialist machine and I went for the Dedica. I looked at lots of reviews and this one came out on top. I have been using it for some time now and it is not delivering the crema that I seek! I do feel a bit let down as I expected an espresso shot with full crema (one that stays on the cup like the head on a Guinness). I even bought super crema beans and it still did not deliver the crema. I’m thinking about going for a nespresso now as they advertise with lots of crema.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Maybe I'm doing something wrong here but this machine is useless! Trying to make an americano, it simply can't cope. I  fill the 2xfilter cup with 3 spoonfulls of Lavazza coffee, pack it down a bit - like I have done with EVERY coffee maker I've ever used! - press the required start button and the machine just about manages to squeeze out about 3 drops of coffee, enough to fill a teaspoon, before giving up! Utterly useless. I quickly learnt not to pack downtoo tightly so the coffee could pass through easier, but to the point of practically not packing it at all. Only then can coffee pass through. This seems ridiculous that it can't cope with a leading coffee brand, of which my previous machine (Krups) and my moka pots have absolutely no trouble with.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: The good news - when it works, the machine makes a good cup of coffee.  But that is the only good news.This is my second machine, the first one bought in May and returned 5 months later, as it started to jam - the machine would start to make a coffee, then stop and when the filter was removed the coffee would explode making a helluva mess.  I would run water through the machine etc etc and it would work again, but sporadically do this thing where it would simply stop working.  Amazon Customer Services were very helpful and sent me another one, which after a couple of months, starting doing exactly the same thing.  I keep the machine clean, de-scale when the machine tells me too, have used different ground coffee and generally treated it like my 3rd child but now it has a new trick - when the coffee has been made and I turn the filter handle to remove it, the inner filter which holds the coffee grounds stays stuck to the machine and then falls into the cup.  Another coffee wasted.  I have spoken to De'Longhi Customer Services who were again, very helpful and said they would send me a replacement filter.  That was 3 weeks ago and I'm still waiting for it.All in all, I wouldn't recommend it and definitely won't be buying another.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Upgrade this little gem to a bottomless basket and you will wonder why you ever spent money in a coffee shop if it wasn't for the atmosphere which you can't buy..Its My go to machine for thoes perfect golden brews and I've had a few mid range and budget machines.This one I just instantly mod it to my preferred use and use it untill it needs a new pump and replace it takes years to kill and the parts are easy get hold of and cheap also great fun strping and assemblingNot as hard as you would think just unplug it of course... and you can't go far wring with all the easy to follow YT vids...Its basically one of the Best budget coofe machines that can produce amazing results with the right touch

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: This has been a fantastic purchase for me. I've had it for quite a while now and have hadn't had any real issues. I use this machine mainly to make espressos and americanos which always have been what I would consider to be high quality. I definitely prefer the coffee from this machine to any that I've managed to make with my coffee presses, percolators or other devices.The only issue I've had is that if I let the water tank get empty or near-empty, the machine won't work for a while after I've refilled this. I'm not sure what causes this but I just try to make sure that I keep the tank pretty full. Other than this I haven't had any issues.One more thing is that this machine takes up very little space and is very easy clean. I would definitely recommend this coffee machine and I would not hesitate to buy another if the need arose.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: I bought this having been a tassimo loyal for many years.This is a very good coffee machine, and it looks the part too.Very easy machine to use and clean. This makes a superior cup of coffee I have to admit and it makes hot coffee too, not the usual like warm brew that pod machines produce, including Nespresso. I bought the bean grinder which is a matching product and the two are absolutely amazing so far. The difference is compelling compared to pods to be honest and the taste is worlds apart. There are a few other purchases you will need to make like knock box and milk jug with a thermometer, but it’s well with the outlay I can assure you.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: This was bought to replace a machine that stopped heating and couldn't be repaired.  It's compact, has a decent size water container, and makes a decent coffee.  Once you program the length of your drink, it's a case of just pressing a button and walking away.  It's a bit clunky and noisy, it's fairly easy to clean, you can remove the drip tray to accommodate longer mugs, which is what I do, I drink americanos without milk using a finely ground coffee to get that good crema on the top.  It comes with a couple of adaptors, so you can use coffee discs, single or double espressos.  It's a decent price, keep an eye out for deals and it will be worth it

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Had an old Gaggia hand lever machine. Rebuilt it as was full on vintage kit. Very hard to use properly. This gets good crema , and if use decent coffee, can get just as good a result.Wife has Americano, so normally has number 5 or 6 strength. Do it on the two cup setting.......twice.......then get decent size cup of decent strength in one sitting. We actually take the bottom plinth out completely and use a mug.Frother works well, and did get proper little stainless jug for that. Also got proper heavy tamper to get good load in the hopper. Keep it down from the top edge, as advised.Ideally get fresh coffee on line ground from beans , but found the LaVazza really good value to be fair. Tried some quite expensive stuff in sealed tins, which were very good, but not worth the way extra expense!

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: I have considered cheaper machines too but, at the end, I have opted for a well known brand. The machine, if left switched on, is on stand-by all the time. One only needs to press the "cup" button, wait a few seconds and the machine is ready to make espresso. Can stop the flow at any time by pressing the "cup"button again. I like short espresso coffee. I really bought it for expresso coffee and not cappuccino. I think someone in the house has tried to make one and I believe it was ok(ish). Having said that. To get a good amount of steam and pressure the machine must have a big tank (just like your steam iron). This will suffice to heat and froth a cup of milk. To expect a shop style cappuccino from such a small machine is simply unreasonable. Excellent machine and easy to clean. One single problem (which is not a big problem). Make sure you always have water in the tank. If not, the machine will not be able to make  you a coffee but it will also "freeze".  Must switch it off from the mains, fill the tank with water and switch it on again. Love it, within a few days, hundreds of coffees and not noisy at all.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: I've bought dedica before and it was good. This time I got it (new, not pre owned) and barely made the first cup of coffee (pumps drops of espresso very slowly). Second time I tried using it it doesn't pump out any espresso, nor even pure water (without any coffee grind in the filter), when using the double filter. The machine was also slightly scratched in various places, which indicates it has been used?? Pretty sure I bought this NEW. It's either an insider job in Amazon reselling returned items as new, or whoever is responsible for providing these items to Amazon are giving them used stuff that are repackaged as *new*. I've returned it, please check the scratches and investigate this. The bottom metal slap has scratches in form of circle, which to me indicates that it's not a manufacturing issue, someone has probably used it and put cups on the metal slap for a while which made this circular scratch pattern. I really hope you investigate this thoroughly. I love Amazon and has been always ordering for 3 years, from the US, UK and Saudi Arabia regions (on my main account, this is my mother's). I hope this doesn't become a continous issue with sellers repackaging used items and false labelling them as new.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: We are so in love with this coffee machine that I had to start buying decaf ground coffee to slow down on the caffeine intake over the weekend!!It was a hard choice initially as I was not sure whether to go for a Nespresso pods machine or the Dedica. I am super glad I bought the Dedica because once you get your head around the way it functions - first 30/40 mins to read the instructions and try it - it is much better than the Nespresso pods machine. It costs much less than coffee pods as it works with ground coffee and the quality of the coffee is really good. Makes an amazing creama!The milk frothier works equally well and the cappuccinos and lattes are delicious.Another big plus is the size: it occupies just a tiny spot on my counter which is small and already crammed with other things.I totally recommend it as it is very good value for its price.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: £199 for this to replace a cheaper machine that had served me well, but had reached the end of the line. The box arrived damaged, wasn’t in an external brown box. On opening, the included sachet of de-scaling fluid was burst and leaking. Cleaned that up, the machine didn’t seem damaged, so went through the pre-use cleaning routine. Then attempted a coffee. The coffee holder was so difficult to insert, and turn to the lock position that you needed to use your other hand to hold the machine while you tried to fit and turn the coffee holder handle. This caused you to accidentally touch the operating buttons on the top. The handle simply would not fit and turn to ‘lock’ without exerting force. Force that simply should not be needed. After five to ten minutes, gave up. Not fit for purpose - have just sent back for a refund. Have ordered another brand of machine, will never try a De’Longhi coffee machine again.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Incredibly happy with this beauitfully made Espresso machine,The is what I liked the most about this machine and why I purchased it. Not only it is relatively slim, it also pretty lightweight considering how professional is, making it easy to store away in a cupboard when not being used.Another well designed feature is that the adjustable steam arm is on the side of the Espresso machine, making it easy to froth/steam the milk whilst the espresso is brewing.You can also have the arm produce hot water instead of steam, so you can make other drinks such as tea and americanos.The most important thing about a coffee machine is the coffee ofcourse and this seems to make one hell of a mean Espresso. The temperature throughout the Espresso being filtered through is well maintained so you do get a bitter/burnt taste.The machine is also relatviely easy to use, but for those unusre on how to use it, there is alot of videos on youtube showcasing how to effectively use and clean the machine.Highly Highly HIGHLY recommend this product,5/5( Click “Helpful” if this helped ^__^ )

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: I have had this product for 8 months and it's the second time I've had problems with it. Currently I can't use it as for the second time the power button won't stay on. When it is working it makes a decent cup of coffee but not great when it comes to creating a creamer. This is the second Delonghi product I've purchased and unfortunately in my experience quality issues appear to be inherent in them,  which is a shame as they're quite stylish products. I would not recommend this product.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: I chose the Dedica after reading many reviews online (in this price range). Not disappointed so far after 1 week of use. This produced amazing flat whites out of the box.My first coffee was made using a 2 year old Aldi ground - and it was pretty good. I then purchased some Ethiopian whole bean from my favourite coffee shop, ground using my burr grinder, steamed semi-skimmed milk and the results were absolutely fantastic - great flavour profile and consistent too! I imagine the results would be as good if I bought pre-ground coffee - maybe better?..The only issue I have experienced was when a few coffees caused the pump to struggle to push water through the coffee/filter - I found the issue was not the Dedica at all and I was grinding the beans too fine (didn't know that was a thing, I do now!).My wife has started using it - the simplicity and results make this a great purchase. I fully recommend the Dedica to newbies who are shopping in this price range.Note: I bought a SS milk jug too as this makes the process easier.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Me and my partner decided to purchase this De’Longhi after extensive research on coffee machines and we do not regret our choice. Beautiful design, shiny chrome finish, operating the machine is quite intuitive and it features a coffee tamper and 3 different filters 2 of which are for ground coffee and 1 for ESE coffee pods. I particularly love the fact that the coffee filter has 3 buds and I don't have to look underneath to mach them to the machine, it goes in pretty easily. We also enjoy the benefit of being able to adjust the machine settings, such as the quantity for each espresso or adjusting the water hardness - the instructions on how to do this are easy to follow.  An other quality worth of mention is that once the coffee or the cappuccino is done the spouts don't drip as much as other coffee machines I've previously owned, only a couple of drops. The machine also has a removable base to allow taller mugs in. I manage to simultaneously fill 2 mugs with coffee although in all fairness the base does not comfortably allow for both of them - still it doesn't bother me that much.Regarding the quality of the coffee no complaints whatsoever - strong coffee and with a nice dense crema on top. Satisfied with the way it frothes the milk as well. We were considering buying a separate milk frother however the one on the machine works great after all! The milk will not overheat as it only takes a bunch of seconds to make a good jug of frothed milk.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: First impression is that it is an attractive machine, but with more plastic parts than expected. It's a slimline machine, which is good because I have a small kitchen with limited counter space. However this means the machine moves when you attach and remove the portafilter, so has to be held firm with the other hand. It is capable of producing a very good coffee, but it is very unreliable. Half the time, there is an error function and you have to strip down the machine and clean each component (and waste a lot of coffee). Also, as you remove the portafilter it often leaves the puck on the machine. It's so frustrating because first thing in the morning I just want to drink some coffee, not become an engineer.I've only had it for a week and I will return it to Amazon soon if it continues to be so unreliable.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: Quite slow and fiddly but if you actually manage to get a cup of coffee it is very nice.  However at least once a week you do the same process as usual and it just refuses to co-operate and you end up with hot soaking coffee grounds everywhere and a wasted shot of expensive coffee.  Clean it all up and do the exact same thing and it works fine.  However, I've never managed to get the foamer to work, it just vibrates and then stops.  Fortunately I generally drink black coffee but still annoying given the price.  I would avoid.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: It does everything that I have asked of it. It makes a great coffee (espresso/latte/capaccino) with a nice creamy head. It uses less coffee than the stove top method so is more economical. The milk frother is very effective too. My husband reports that it tastes like 'barista' coffee.we use Bean Press Gedo Ethiopia Beans which we grind fresh each time and coconut sugar.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: This is our third espresso coffee maker and for design and making great coffee, it is far the best. For convenience we use ESE pods instead of ground coffee, and we find the machine operates fine with the pods. The milk warmer can be adjusted to deliver an excellent froth for cappuccino, or just hot milk without the froth. We live in hard water area , so the machine will require de-scaling on a regular basis. However, the machine has an adjustable amber warning light, that alerts you to the fact that the machine needs de-scaling. Very stylish machine and would highly recommend.

Product Title: Delonghi EC685.M DEDICA 15-Bar Pump Espresso Machine Coffee Maker, Stainless Steel, 220 Volts (Not for USA - European Cord)
Review Description: I had to give one star to write the review, it would have got none if I been able to not give any.First off, it came with a European plug, NOT a UK 3 pin. So, ok, I got an adaptor.  It a great start.Second, the frother/milk warmer is awful. Difficult to use and messy, it gives pretty poor results. I have owned many different coffee makers over the last 30 years and this is the worst so far.The last theee coffees I have tried to make have ended in disaster. The pump seems to have failed and is putting little to no water through the coffee. The coffee comes out wet and loose, not compressed like it should.
